episode_summary: This episode of No Such Thing As A Fish covers a range of fascinating topics, including the history of bridges connecting Europe and Asia, Martin Scorsese's fast-talking requiring a translator, the dietary taboos of Indigenous Arctic peoples, and the rare condition of having multiple penises.

facts.fact: After the first bridge from Europe to Asia was built, it took 33 years to build the second and 2,453 years to build the third.
Because he talks so fast, when Martin Scorsese spoke at an international film festival, they had to provide an additional translator to first translate his fast words into slower words.
Indigenous Arctic peoples were absolutely banned from eating the surf and turf.
Men can have three penises without knowing it.
